Authors: Santoso I., Gulo R.S., Girsang A.S.
Title: An adaptive cat swarm optimization based on particle swarm optimization approach (ACPSO) for clustering
Source title: International Review on Computers and Software
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan no. 9, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santoso, I., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan no. 9, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Gulo, R.S., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan no. 9, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan no. 9, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper proposes an adaptive cat swarm optimization based on particle swarm optimization for clustering, called ACPSO. Unlike the cat swam optimization that operates one cat, this algorithm uses some cats as population bases to converge the result. ACPSO employs an adaptive method by choosing a seeking mode or tracing mode based on a mixture ratio (MR). In the tracing mode, this algorithm uses a modified particle swarm optimization to increase diversity solutions. To demonstrate the performance, ACPSO was conducted to solve some datasets clustering problem. The results show that ACPSO has a good performance compared to the other methods. © 2016 Praise Worthy Prize S.r.l. - All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Cat swarm optimization; Clustering; CSO; Data clustering; PSO

Title: A Personal Agents in Ubiquitous Environment: A Survey
Affiliations: Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ricky, M.Y., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gulo, R.S., Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: A personal agents can be implements in various areas. The previous work has been conducted in website and mobile in corresponding to information retrieval, mobile computing, and artificial intelligence. There are different methods and framework are proposed in previous research to obtain and enhance agent's performance for better recommendations. This research aims to present comparison previous research based on personal agent in different areas for understanding of proposed framework design, architecture and its implementations. Personal agent can be applied to analyse and assisting in completing task especially for solving one purpose, and multi agents system can be applied at education, industrial, commercial, governmental, military, and entertainment applications for solving multi purposes. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Adaptive Agent; Collaborative System; Intelligence Agent; Personal Agent
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Military applications; Multi agent systems; Adaptive agents; Collaborative systems; Entertainment application; Framework designs; Intelligence agents; Multi-agents systems; Personal Agent; Ubiquitous environments; Intelligent agents
